column4: I've just installed libglib2.0-0 2.30.2, but libgimp2.0 : Depends: libglib2.0 (>= 2.30.2)
and it won't install
anybody tell me why libglib2.0 is showing the correct version required in apt-cache showpkg - yet apt won't install ?
can I tell apt to force install ?
what does 'ldd  _file_' say?
hrmm which _file_ would that be

libglib2.0. Guessing that's a shared library? If it is, it's possibly looking for the required library in the wrong path. In that case you'll have to create a symlink to the real file in the location libglib2.0 is looking.
I'm trying to use apt-get to install gimp 2.7.5 from matt's repo
unfortunately his instructions to add ricotz & gnome3 repos are not working
do you have a pastebin?
https://launchpad.net/~matthaeus123/+archive/mrw-gimp-svn
sure I have pastebin
of the error message.
but ldd isn't going to help, cause I haven't installed gimp2.7.5 yet
it reports you missing libglib?
missing the correct version to continue to install libgimp2.0
and with apt-cache showpkg libglib2.0-0 I KNOW I have the right version
need to tell apt it's got it's facts wrong
http://pastebin.com/Vf6zYmu7
did you check for libglib2.0 having unmet dependencies?
http://pastebin.com/PeEjPiAk
